question: Which are the two countries that share the location of "Mont Blanc"?
explanation: Mont Blanc is a 4808 meters high mountain located between the bordering regions of Italy and France. It is the second-highest mountain in Europe after Mount Elbrus. It is the highest mountain in the Alps. The Graian Alps form the parent mountain range of Mont Blanc. This mountain houses Mont Blanc Tunnel which connects both Italy and France. Mont Blanc is the highest point in France.
